Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```{ "NOTARI_TXID": "Notarized Txid" },
            { "NOTARI_TXID_HEIGHT": "Notarization Txid Height" },```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so instead of showing "Notarization Destination Txid" the page is now showing "Notarized Txid_HEIGHT"

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @jl777c what you want me to do to fix it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the bug we are trying to fix?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: doesnt it work now?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so instead of showing "Notarization Destination Txid" the page is now showing "Notarized Txid_HEIGHT"

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I changed it back in local files and you can see the highlited text with `_`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it is currently showing the right info, isnt it?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: nope

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what should it display?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Notarization Txid Height

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how does changing $NOTARI_TXID_HEIGHT -> $NOTARI_TX_ID_HEIGHT fix it?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: that's without Underscore and the whole word "HEIGHT" is not upper case, just the "H" letter of the word "Height" is uppercase.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, i understand that, but your pull request only changed the variable name

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which doesnt affect what is displayed

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: "NOTARI_TXID" json key was conflicting with "NOTARI_TXID_HEIGHT" json key.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: putting "NOTARI_TXID"'s value for "NOTARI_TXID_HEIGHT" and just printing "_HEIGHT".

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to fix that, put the longer variable name first

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the english.json file

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: put the NOTARI_TXID_HEIGHT before NOTARI_TXID

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: okay, let me try

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes that worked!

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: thanks, pushing this change

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c Why do nSPV node need sometime before it start working? Even normal nodes need some time before they relay transactions to each other. I noticed that like half a year ago it was better - it started relaying txs very soon from start but at some point it got longer. When I start superlite nspv node it needs few minutes before it can receive response from full node.
